verses.roman:
ity uktvā taṁ parikramya
pādau spṛṣṭvā sva-maulinā
anujñāto vimānāgryam
āruhat paśyatāṁ nṛṇām

synonyms: iti—thus; uktvā—having spoken; tam—Him; parikramya—circumambulating; pādau—His feet; spṛṣṭvā—touching; sva—with his; maulinā—crown; anujñātaḥ—given leave; vimāna—a celestial airplane; agryam—excellent; āruhat—he boarded; paśyatām—as they watched; nṛṇām—humans.
translation: Having spoken thus, Mahārāja Nṛga circumambulated Lord Kṛṣṇa and touched his crown to the Lord's feet. Granted permission to depart, King Nṛga then boarded a wonderful celestial airplane as all the people present looked on.
